Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and describe the habitat they are illustrating, whether it's on land or in water.
The student can include and label different kinds of plants and animals found in the chosen habitat.
The student can show and label at least three different types of living things within the habitat in their drawing (e.g., trees, flowers, birds, insects, fish).
The student can compare the diversity of living things by labeling different organisms in at least two habitats if drawing more than one.
The student can organize the drawing to clearly show patterns they observed or researched, such as which plants or animals are more common in certain habitats.
The student can use their drawing to explain their observations about how plants and animals are organized in different habitats.
